section.title: Reading
section.p: Read the first three subsections of Section 8.3 of Applied Discrete Structures. This will take you up to, but not including the section titled Solution of Nonhomogeneous Finite Order Linear Relations.

Response Question: One of the main reasons why recurrence relations are part of this course is that the time and/or memory needs of a computer algorithm are often measured by first identifying a recurrence relation. For example many sorting algorithm take a time that is proportional to n^2 to sort n items. If you are using an algorithm of this type, and it takes three minutes to sort a file with 10 million items, how long would you expect the algorithm to take to sort 20 million items?

Also, turn in solutions to these exercises:
Find a closed form expression that for the sequence S(n) if S(0)=4 and S(n)=3 \dot S(n-1) if n \gt 0.
Find a closed form expression that for the sequence T(n) if T(0)=1, T(1)= 5 and T(n)- 3\dot T(n-1) + 4\dot T(n-2)=0 if n \gt 2.

li.p: Find a closed form expression that for the sequence V(n) if V(0)=2, V(1)= 3 and V(n)= \frac{1}{2}\dot V(n-1)- \frac{1}{2}\dot V(n-2) if n \gt 2.
Find a closed form expression that for the sequence Q(n) if Q(0)=3, Q(1)= 0 and Q(n)=6\dot Q(n-1)-9\dot Q(n-2) if n \gt 2.
Find a closed form expression that for the sequence Q(n) if Q(0)=3, Q(1)= 0 and Q(n)=6\dot Q(n-1)-9\dot Q(n-2) if n \gt 2.

The recurrence relation R(n)=R(n-1)+2^n, n \geq 1 is non-homogeneous. This is the subject of the next class, but it can be turned into a second order homogeneous recurrence relation. So so and find the general solution to that recurrence relation.
